ratings.comment: Best professor in Wisconsin
best professor at uw madison
Best Instructor I have ever had!!! Really kind to students! Very Humorous in class. Too bad he is retiring  :-(
He's a great professor in how he delivers content. His class is well structured with lots of emphasis on active learning through exercises in class and in projects.

WisCEL holds your hand with everything. Don't let the exercises fool you, exams count the most followed by homework. You get assigned a partner in the lab that meets once every 3 weeks (I was out within 15 mins every time). Homework ranges from easy moodle quiz to impossible Quartus file. Projects generally easy. Michael is  amazing and funny!

This class is incredibly difficult and you will have to work more than ever to even try to pass. His exams don't make any sense and his teaching style isn't useful for people who actually need lectures to learn. The course also does not follow the textbook and the exams are worth a large portion of the final grade.

ECE 352 is a fundamental course for the progression of ECE. Unfortunately the way this class is taught is all online based on videos. The professor does not offer the best help when stuck on situations rather he poses more questions to your question.  Be prepared to work more than you ever have in this class, even though its 3 credits.

Michael is hilarious and super helpful. ECE252 might be the easiest CS/CE class at UW combined with WisCEL which is super helpful so this class is basically a cake walk. Make sure you understand LC-3 and you are golden. Steer clear of his wife at all costs, she kicks people out of the university for minor academic misconduct violations.

It's hard to not get an A in this class. He establishes very clear learning expectations on day 1 and tells you what will be on an assessment. Him and his wife (who also teaches the class) have 20 hrs/wk office hours. Expect a decent amount of out-of-class work, especially for homework. Always willing to answer questions, even the dumb ones

Loved this professor!  He was funny and helpful both outside of class and during the in class exercises.  Loved the way this class was taught, with interactive Moodle exercises and optional lecture.  Learned TONS.  That being said, be aware that there was a substantial amount of outside class work, including 6 exams, weekly lecture videos, readings

He's a great guy and gives you plenty of resources to do well in the class.  You'll never use the textbook, don't but it.  Also don't try to copy homework; he compares timestamps on submissions and location and will write you up to the dean if he catches you copying/giving answers on homework or anything else.  Great guy though.
If you ask a stupid question he'll give you sass but he is hilarious about it. I have taken three classes with him and would gladly take more

Morrow has very clear learning targets that he outlines in his syllabus. Focus on knowing the concepts and definitions outlined here and you'll be golden for his exams. One of the most straight-forward and well-organized classes I've taken at this university. Was also very willing to answer questions in office hours.
Very clear teaching style, very helpful, and a fun professor. Watching out of class videos are essential to doing well, but he is always there to help. Would definitely take his classes again!
He's not very nice when answering questions but is a very good professor.
Michael Morrow is a great professor.  If you are ever at a loss he is very helpful with questions. Online lectures are informative but fast-paced.

Mr. Morrow is awesome! He is funny, helpful and clear. All of the tests are based on wiscel exercises and educational objectives. The only thing to watch out for is the Written Homeworks, some of them are easy, but you'll want to give yourself extra time for the ones that require quartus .

He's clear, straightforward, knowledgeable, and fair. Basically what a professor should be. Not the easiest professor, but not too hard either. WisCEL sessions are helpful. Exams aren't too bad if you properly prepare. One of the best professors I have had at UW.
Morrow is a great professor. Can be a little intimidating if you don't know him, but he always means well and explains things very clearly.
Morrow is the best teacher I have ever had!

Morrow was tough but very fair. He set up this class for students to learn and master the content. He would rather see students learn than necessarily get perfect grades. He is really helpful although can be sarcastic at times. I really enjoyed the class and would recommend.
By far the best professor that I've had. Do the homeworks, go to lecture, and you'll be fine. If you can take a class with him, you should take a class with him.

352 is a lot, a lot, a lot of work.  A LOT. Prepare to dedicate  many hours to this class as if it was worth 9 credits.  Morrow is a pretty good prof, he can be scary at first and loud but he does go through material clearly.  The only bad thing about this class is how everything is online...

Probably my best and favorite professor yet, and I'm a Junior.  Taught extremely well, he has an awesome personality and is obviously passionate about teaching.  The workload is heavy, but you learn as you go and don't have too much studying to do for test.  Not on a curve, but he gives you ample opportunity to get an A because of great teaching.

Prof Morrow is the man! He asks questions in class, he doesn't call on people but answering questions is your chance to stand out! READ the textbook and do practice problems in textbooks' lecture notes before attending lectures. The class will become extremely easy!!! DO go to class for Moodle exercises!!!! Go to OH, he gives you tips to do well!!!

Professor Morrow definitely earns the nickname "The Commander." He is a genius in both his field and in the field of teaching. He knows how to make his points clear, but he is VERY sarcastic at times. He means well, but can come off as demeaning. Nevertheless, he makes all the tough concepts very manageable, overall good professor.
Flipped classroom was super helpful, he knows everything that he teaches really well and can explain it

Prof. Morrow is a great professor.  He knows everything and anything that you could ask him and teaches in a way that is hard not to understand.  He gives you the resources to succeed and has a great sense of humor.  I recommend him to anyone taking classes that he teaches.  Job well done Mike Morrow.

Commander Morrow is a bit intimidating at first. Being ex-navy, he's very loud and can come off as mean and sarcastic sometimes, but has good intentions. Makes material very clear and is helpful during office hours if needed. Course is taught in a very cool blended way. Don't buy the textbook, never used once.

The Commander is easily the best professor I've ever had. Takes the hard material, and spilts up lectures into 1 lecture per week, and 2 hours of group work. Learned the material very well. Exams tested if you paid attention. Easy to do well if you try. Very clear teaching. Also actually fun. 10/10

Morrow is the best professor I have ever had in any of my STEM courses at UW. The class is structured to make learning as enjoyable and painless as possible. You meet to do exercises twice a week which REALLY help you learn the content. Tests are very fair, no tricks.

This man is the greatest professor that I have ever had the privilege to receive. Honestly, words cannot describe how awesome this guy is. Truth be told that he challenges your abilities, but he gives you the exact tools necessary to succeed. During each registration period I search for any and all classes that he teaches. Best prof on campus.

By far the best ECE teacher i've had the pleasure of having for multiple classes. Probably gives some of the hardest tests, but he's amazing in teaching, lectures are a perfect representation of what is on the exams, and he is just extremely fun to listen to. Will keep you awake through everything, and you actually LEARN with this guy!

We voted him instructor of the year for a reason- honestly the best prof I've ever had, learned a ton in his class. His experimental teaching style really works (lots of in class quizzes but they're incredibly helpful). He's also a cool guy to get to know, and he's funny too!
Probably my favorite professor at Madison. He's not the easiest but he's an awesome guy to learn from. If you can, take a class with him at all costs! O ya, he can fly planes too :P
Awesome professor, very humorous, loves to tell stories and give real world examples.  By the end of this class you will have a solid foundation in circuits, and know what NAVY really stands for.

its a 1 cr lab course so not much interaction with prof, but he still designed/maintains the course.  Make sure you have a good TA and you have a lab partner who knows what they are doing, expect to work quite a bit for an A.

great teacher, funny, easy to talk to, interesting lectures, homework and exam questions which are just the right difficulty and actually test knowledge - biggest plus for me was the real world examples.
He manages to be both an excellent instructor and a nice guy to interact with.

Amazing professor working in a class whose format is outdated. Excellent at applying what you learn to real life, since he runs his own consulting business. Good at helping you understand material without talking down to you. Tests are a bit funky, and the project will challenge the hell out of you, but totally worth it. Favorite ECE Professor yet!

Awesome guy, teaches material well, but more importantly, teaches about real-world engineering since he's actually in the industry, not a real professor. Really knows his stuff. Very helpful in office hours. Lectures entertaining and always worthwhile. Wish I would have had him for 353!
Good class. Good prof. Changing formats after this semester. Very informative and interesting. Challenging.
Mike is a great professor, and a great guy. His lectures are always useful, sometimes humorous.  His classes are challenging, but valuable.
A great man to learn from!  Take his class section whenever possible!

This man is very intelligent.  He also has the ability to teach hard material without making you feel inferior. He does an excellent job aplying the things you learn to real life. He is also very helpful in office hours. Great guy to just go and talk to!!!

A great professor.  This guy really knows his stuff and it shows.  I appreciate how he tried to relate his lectures to engineering in the "real world."  Yeah, the exams and homework are challenging, but it is definitely useful material.
